lexUnit.name: stow.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pack or store (an object) tidily in an appropriate place.

sentence.text: She folded his discarded jeans and shirt and stowed them in a locker , then turned his sleeping-bag inside out and shook it .
He stowed the globes in a styrofoam case like an over-sized egg box .
Melissa stowed her purchases in her shopping bag and picked up her change .
He gave them some thought , then extracted two and stowed them in his hip pocket .
Most people keep a gun or two in the house ; some carry them around with them , or stow them in the glove compartments of their cars .
He emptied his bag , putting the instruments for sterilization to one side and stowing the unused items on the shelves .
When he hears Tina 's key in the lock he slaps the latest book shut and stows the pile under the bed , his head aching with the notion that he was about to stumble on the message .
He had n't stowed his chainsword across his back , and Ace watched aghast as he swung himself too far , reached out with his left hand , and failed to grasp the side of the girder .
They stowed Tal behind their seats , with her bag and all the other stuff that had accumulated there .
Stowing her bag by her feet , Loretta settled down for an hour 's read .
Then he went back to stowing the suitcases into the car .
` It 's beautiful , " I said as the man stowed the parcels into the tiny cabin .
She found a seat , stowed her luggage , and was almost at once joined by a pleasant-faced woman who settled herself across the table in the seat opposite .
As he groped his way under his seat , seeking somewhere to stow the paper , his fingers met something cold and hard and sharp .
Here , Goodison lifted four large mantle-boxes from the coach and stowed them , as best he could , under the seat of Elizabeth 's trap .
By the time they had their health certificates the cargo , mostly cotton cloth from Manchester , had been stowed .
The doctor had fixed it in place in the car , as we waited for the luggage to be stowed .
It will be stowed either in the carrying case or within a plastic container .
A considerable swell was breaking on the beach , so cameras were stowed in plastic bags and we surfed ashore in an inflatable in what is known as a ` wet landing " .
They did not see anything being stowed on the wagon for Ramsey .
Water bottles and coffee dellas were stowed on the back seat .
He went into a torrent of Greek as he stowed her case and several pieces of hand luggage .
He had already stowed the cockpit awning and set up the barbecue .
I opened my eyes eventually and took the compass out of my jeans pocket , where I 'd stowed it to have hands free for standing up .
Sleep-drugged figures stumble quietly around their bivouacs , feeling for the last few items of rain-sodden kit to stow in their bergens .
Order a take away and open the bottle you have stowed in your Survival Pack .
